Element.Goal: To maintain the load bearing fuction up to the design accidental load
Element.Name: Structure

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Motion criteria stated in design bases shall not be exceeded.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: The Hull structure and anchoring mechanism shall be sufficient to support the topside facilities, appurtenances (i.e. risers, conductors, caissons, ) and topside structures (flare, helideck) ensuring stability under all foreseeable operational, environmental and accidental conditions.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The design codes and load analysis cases have been specified for the topsides in the Structural Design Brief and for LQ.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: The primary structures shall be built to a recognised national or international standard addressing fatigue, corrosion protection, defects, subsidence, redundancy and accidental loading.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Criteria stated in design bases shall not be exceeded.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: Topside support structures shall be capable of supporting all necessary loads under normal conditions and in the event of external loading caused by extreme environmental conditions.
The RUBY FPSO shall have a service life of 20 years

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Application of normal factors of safety, in accordance with the requirements the associated recognised codes and standards
FunctionalRequirement.Function: The topsides structures shall support the equipment and bulk materials making up the topsides facilities for all foreseeable operational and environmental load conditions.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Acceptable recognised vibration limits to prevent structural damage???
FunctionalRequirement.Function: Vibration on the structure shall be controlled within the acceptable recognized limit.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Separation/isolation shall be sufficient to preventing an escalation considering probable effect distance or possiblity of successive collapse of structure
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide safety by distance or seprartion to prevent an escalation of an initiating event

FunctionalRequirement.Assurance: Type certification of the watertight door
FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Waterhead to be contained checked against probable accident?
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To prevent flooding in an area from spreading beyond the area of accident

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: Load-bearing structures shall maintain satisfactory safety in use, failure, fatigue and accident limit states. They shall be able to withstand the loads they are exposed to, including loads with an annual probability of 10-2 in the failure limit state.
Load-bearing structures shall be sufficiently robust to ensure that local damage or failure will not result in unacceptable consequences.

MAHSurvivability.SurvCriterion:
Primary steelwork shall be protected against the effects of dimensioning fire scenarios as provided in the DAL specification.
Load bearing structures shall be provided with passive fire protection coatings, as defined in the Active and Passive Fire Protection Specification.
The Topside structure shall be able to withstand the effects of dimensioning explosion loads as defined in the DAL specification.
Topsides structures shall be designed to absorb the energy from dropped and swinging loads as defined in the DAL specification.

The hull structure shall survive damage from dimensioning boat impact, with post damage survivability sufficient to support the maximum topsides load under defined storm conditions. Boat collision impact to be withstood has been defined in the DAL specification.

Where structural supports, which upon failure or collapse are likely to cause loss of a main safety function, are located within reach of green sea, they shall be designed to withstand the green water loads.

Element.Goal: To maintain the FPSO position and provide reliable connection to flow lines. The system must enable the FPSO to weathervane and to withstand all design environmental conditions sufficiently to maintain riser and umbilical integrity
Element.Name: Turret mooring system

SubElement.Name: Turret Swivel Support Structure (Inner Support Structure)

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Offsets during single and double line failure shall not cause the risers to fail and interference between riser and mooring shall be avoided
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To maintain the FPSO position

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The mooring system shall be designed to remain connected all year round and through all the ranges of Metocean data specified.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide reliable connection to flow lines
The FPSO shall be freely weathervaning using a passive turret mooring system, with the turret located in front of product tanks.
The position, angle and tension of each mooring line shall be monitored and recorded. Alarms shall be raised in the CCR in the event of design operating limitations being exceeded
Turret structure (outerwall) shall withstand design explosion load with adequate explosion load relief method
TMS shall be disconnectable in a reliable manner to allow FPSO to leave upon extreme environment

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: Position keeping shall be available upon a loss of one mooring line

MAHSurvivability.SurvCriterion: Max heat load of xxx kW/m2 as per FRA

The turret cylinder structure (outer wall) shall be designed to withstand explosion overpressure of 1.5 barg. Explosion relief panle of XX m2 at the top of the turret shall open at the overpressure of xx barg.

DependentSCE.DepDescription: Primary members are protected by PFO when necessary

Element.Goal: To monitor vessel actvities and provide adequate information to prevent collisio and navigational aide for vessels and helicopter
Element.Name: Ship collision avoidance & navigation aid

SubElement.Boundary: Visual Signal System (Navigation Aid System and Warning Light)
SubElement.Name: Visual Signal System (Navigation Aid System and Warning Light)

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The system shall present vessel movements on graphics that are based on marine charts. The system shall provide the facility to track and identify the vessels, initiate alarms should the vessels enter pre-defined exclusion zones or be on course that would in any way present a risk to the installation or the operation in the proximity of the platform. The information from the tracking system may be integrated with data from other installations and made available to other agencies. As such the system shall have the capability to store and hand off the data.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: There shall be a collision monitoring system able to detect a vessel on collision course.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The radar system shall be able to register the course and speed of the object, and plotting facilities shall be included, e.g. automatic radar, plotting aid. Radar signals shall be transmitted to unit responsible for surveillance. The RADAR system shall be interfaced with 'StatoilHydro Surveillance RADAR system' (Statoil Marine VTS)
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To register the course and speed of the object

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: A Differential Global Positioning System (DGPS) shall provide accurate positional information to various systems
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide exact location of RUBY FPSO for vessels to avoid collision course

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria:
Two (2) complete sets of radar shall be provided, with long range (S band) and accuracy (X band) features fitted with automatic radar plotting aids (ARPA) and interfaced with Gyrocompass, Automatic Identification system (AIS), DGPS systems to provide trajectory predictions and collision avoidance alerts for safety marine operation.
- The radars shall display in the radio room and Offloading Control Room
- The radar shall give all round coverage around the FPSO with minimum blind sector allowed by classification rules, and with a detection distance of 30 nautical Miles from the FPSO.
- Radar antennas shall be separated and placed to prevent any shadow effect.
- Radars components shall comply with Electromagnetic Compatibility Regulations
- The radar shall detect crafts 5-10 nm (not less than 5 nm)
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide interfaces between RADAR and other systems to provide trajectory predictions and collision avoidance alerts for safety marine operation.

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Compliance to Class rule and Tech specification
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To ensure communication with other vessels, helicopter pilots and onshore control statoins

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Shuttle tanker positioning system ... accuracy? warning upon proximity?
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To monitor the positon of the shuttle tanker

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Class rule / Available upon a single failure
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide visual signal for navigational aid in a reliable manner

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: RADAR shall work continuously with electric power backedup
AIS shall work continuously with electric power backedup
Communication with vessels, helicopters, headquarter onshore shall be available continuously

Marine navigational aids shall have a self contained battery power supply sufficient to maintain the systems in operation for 96 hours. Reliability is assured by the use of primary and secondary lights and horns.

DependentSCE.DepDescription: Flooding due to ship collision can be controlled by the ballast system
DependentSCE.DepSCEName: SCE03 Ballast and bilge system - based on Goliat FPSO

Element.Goal: To provide propulsion and steering to move away from the operatoin field upon harsh weather or to move to a new field without external support
Element.Name: Propulsion

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Cold start???
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To mobilize FPSO without external supprt

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Fuel for XX days of navigation?
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To navigate to a place of safety without external support

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: The propulsion and steering capabitly shall be available within XX hours

SubElementAvailability.AvailabiltyAssurance: Compressed air for XX times of ...

MAHSurvivability.SurvCriterion: Max heat load of 10 kW/m2 as per FRA
The TR shall be designed to withstand explosion overpressure of 0.xx barg and other accidental loads specified in the report XXXXXX.

DependentSCE.DepDescription: Primary members are protected by PFO when necessary

Element.Goal: To provide a safe landing and take off area for helicopter operation
Element.Name: Helideck

FunctionalRequirement.Assurance:
- UK CAP 437 “Standards for offshore helicopter landing areas” 8th edition, 2016
- ICAO Annex 14 volume 2 “Aerodromes - Heliports” 4th edition, 2013
- DGCA section 4 series B part 3 “Heliports” revision 4, 2018
- DGCA Joint SOP “Night medical evacuation operation(Helicopters offshore)” revision 0, 2018
FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The Helideck strength shall comply with CAP 437, CAAP 92-2 and AMSA Marine orders parts 12,14,17 and 60 and shall be suitable for the largest helicopter anticipated to be used at the RUBY FPSO.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: Helideck structure shall be capable, for the duration of the operational life of the platform, of providing structural support that accommodates the relevant helicopter operations ensuring stability under all foreseeable operational, environmental conditions. Super Puma AS332L2

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The Helideck shall be capable of withstanding heavy normal landing and emergency landing as specified in CAP 437, based on the largest helicopter anticipated to be used at the RUBY FPSO.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To withstand impact load

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Three(3) access points(120 degrees between each access point) shall be arranged to escape upwind and removable or collapsible handrail will be arranged where exceeding the height limitation.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide three (3) access points

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria:
Flush type tie-down point shall be provided on helideck surface of landing area and parking area. Drain pipe shall be fitted to each tie down point and shall be connected to gutter drain line.
One (1) set of illuminated windsock and supporting post shall be provided. Supporting post shall be provided with means of access for maintenance of windsock and light.
Glide path indicator(GPI)/Helicopter approach path indicator(HAPI) for day and night medevac shall be provided
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide navigational aids

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: Helideck design shall minimise the potential environmental effects (turbulence air movement, thermal effects, flammable gas), as far as practicable. Operations restrictions shall be clearly specified in the Helicopter Operations Procedures.
SubElementAvailability.AvailabiltyAssurance: Unavailability calculation in accordance with CAP 437

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: Unserviceable helicopter shall be handled by the pedestal crane to portside laydown area or offshore service vessel.
SubElementAvailability.AvailabiltyAssurance: Written procedure to ensure forthe AFT main crane to handle an unserviceable helicopter

MAHSurvivability.SurvCriterion: The helideck and associated equipment shall be in compliance with CAP 437, CAAP 92-2 and ... to withstand crash load of XX.
A deck integrated firefighting system(DIFFs) shall be provided for the helideck

DependentSCE.DepDescription: The helideck is supported by and connected to the LQ.

Element.Goal:
The ballast water system shall provide easy and reliable facilities for ballast water distribution in order to maintain control of the floating offshore installation during routine operations and emergency situations, in terms of stability, heel, trim and draft and ensuring that hull stresses do not exceed the design strength criteria.  
The bilge system shall provide easy and reliable facilities for pumping from and draining watertight compartments.
Element.Name: Ballast and bilge system - based on Goliat FPSO

SubElement.Name: Ballast Water Tank, Vent and Level Monitoring
Emergency Bilge Suction (connected to Main Cooling S.W. Pump in E/R)

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The capacity of the ballast system shall also comply with §11 of the NMD Ballast regulations.
FunctionalRequirement.Function:
To maintain heel, trim and hull girder loads within normal operating limits and to
prevent severe weather bow emergence and re-entry slamming at light drafts without recourse to emergency ballasting of cargo or slops tanks

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The ballast system shall be equipped with at least two independent pumps.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To maintain ballasting in the event of failure of one pump

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: The ballast system shall be arranged with cross connections ensuring that ballast water can be cross fed from one side of the vessel to the other as a contingency measure.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To cross-feed ballast water from one side of the vessel to the other

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: Ballast system valves shall be designed fail-to-close
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To provide fail-safe function for the ballast valves

FunctionalRequirement.Criteria: An effective bilge system shall be provided for draining watertight compartments, e.g. primary bilge pump and emergency bilge pump.
FunctionalRequirement.Function: To drain watertight compartments

SubElementAvailability.AvailabilityCriterion: The ballast control system emergency shutdown loop (logic and final element) shall have a minimum Safety Safety Integrity Level (SIL) rating of SIL 2 in accordance with IEC61508/OLF GL070.
Ballasting operation shall be continued upon a single failure

Two sets of ballast pumps are provided. Ballast piping shall be two (2) main line and two(2) cross connection. And design of ballast piping (port and starboard) shall be separated. Each ballast pump shall be able to take suction and strip from any ballast tank and discharge ballast directly overboard. Ballast water can be transferred from a water ballast tank in port side to a water ballast tank in starboard side and vice versa.

One aire driven pump at the following rooms: FWD VOID & Chain locker, Utility room, FWD fire water pump rooms (P) and (S), Turret VOID, Cofferdam & one portable air driven pump for oil spill on upper deck
SubElementAvailability.AvailabiltyAssurance: IMO regulation and the requirement of Classification Society

MAHSurvivability.SurvCriterion: An explosion or similar event in the pump room or double bottom shall not lead to an uncontrollable situation due to malfunction of the ballast system. [Copied from Goliat FPSO; looks too demanding]
Void spaces which are regarded as buoyancy volumes shall be provided with means for checking water tightness e.g. leak detection.
Watertight structural members shall be provided with means for effective drainage and sounding, e.g. water detector or level indication

Measures to avoid unintentional internal filling of buoyancy compartments from seawater systems shall be implemented, e.g. routing of piping outside buoyancy compartments if possible, as far as possible avoid leak sources within buoyancy compartments, consider implementing possibilities for stopping firewater pumps from CCR, consider introduction of automatic stop of seawater and firewater pumps on high water level detection within buoyancy compartments.
